creator: Amanda Silberling
title: (No AI) Toy Story 5 takes aim at creepy AI toys: ‘I’m always listening’
dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
content: Addictive, AI-enabled tablets are taking over, and also, Woody is balding in the new Toy Story movie, out June 19.
contentSnippet: Addictive, AI-enabled tablets are taking over, and also, Woody is balding in the new Toy Story movie, out June 19.

creator: Rebecca Bellan
title: (No AI) AI’s promise to indie filmmakers: faster, cheaper, lonelier
dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
content: AI expands access to filmmaking for resource-constrained creators. But as efficiency becomes the industry’s north star, creativity risks being overwhelmed by a deluge of low-effort, AI-generated content.
contentSnippet: AI expands access to filmmaking for resource-constrained creators. But as efficiency becomes the industry’s north star, creativity risks being overwhelmed by a deluge of low-effort, AI-generated content.

title: (No AI) The Pitt has a sharp take on AI
author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
content:
![A woman standing in an emergency room with a tablet in her hands and a concerned look on her face.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/sepideh-moafi-1.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Each episode of HBO's _The Pitt_ features some degree of medical trauma that almost makes the hospital drama feel like a horror series. Some patients are dealing with gnarly lacerations while others are fighting off vicious blood infections that could rob them of their limbs, and the chaos of working in an emergency room often leaves _The Pitt_'s central characters shaken. But as alarming as many of _The Pitt_'s more gore-forward moments can be, what's even more unsettling is the show's slow-burning subplot about hospitals adopting generative artificial intelligence.

In its second season, _The Pitt_ once again chronicles all the events that happen …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/entertainment/881016/hbo-the-pitt-generative-ai-charting)

Some patients are dealing with gnarly lacerations while others are fighting off vicious blood infections that could rob them of their limbs, and the chaos of working in an emergency room often leaves The Pitt's central characters shaken. But as alarming as many of The Pitt's more gore-forward moments can be, what's even more unsettling is the show's slow-burning subplot about hospitals adopting generative artificial intelligence.
In its second season, The Pitt once again chronicles all the events that happen  …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) The AI security nightmare is here and it looks suspiciously like lobster
author: Robert Hart
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/STKB382_OPEN_CLAW_B_a2aa40.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

A hacker tricked a popular AI coding tool into installing OpenClaw - the [viral, open-source AI agent OpenClaw](https://www.theverge.com/news/872091/openclaw-moltbot-clawdbot-ai-agent-news) that "actually does things" - absolutely everywhere. Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what to come as more and more people let autonomous software use their computers on their behalf.

The hacker took advantage of a vulnerability in Cline, an open-source AI coding agent popular among developers, that security researcher Adnan Khan had [surfaced](https://adnanthekhan.com/posts/clinejection/) just days earlier as a proof of concept. Simply put, Cline's workflow used Anthropic's Claude, which could be fed sneaky instructions and made to do things that it shouldn't, a technique known …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/881574/cline-openclaw-prompt-injection-hack)

The hacker took advantage of a vulnerability in Cline, an open-source AI coding agent popular among developers, that security researcher Adnan Khan had surfaced just days earlier as a proof of concept. Simply put, Cline's workflow used Anthropic's Claude, which could be fed sneaky instructions and made to do things that it shouldn't, a technique known  …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) Advancing independent research on AI alignment
content: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.
contentSnippet: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music

creator: Rhett Allain
title: (No AI) Could AI Data Centers Be Moved to Outer Space?

creator: Jason Parham
title: (No AI) The Search Engine for OnlyFans Models Who Look Like Your Crush
dc:creator: Jason Parham
content: Presearch’s “Doppelgänger” is trying to help people discover adult creators rather than use nonconsensual deepfakes.
